Event.name: Visit_host_departure
Event.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Visitor</fen> departs from a Host_location after having visited a Host.</def-root>

Arg.name: Visitor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Visitor</fen> departs from the location of the Host.</def-root>

Arg.name: Host_location
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Visitor</fen> departs from the <fen>Host_location</fen>, a location strongly associated with the Host.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the trajectory of the departure which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a sense meaning 'via'.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE labels any expression which tells where the <fen>Visitor</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of departing from the <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and many other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions, though <fen>Speed</fen> and <fen>Means</fen> should be tagged using the more specific FE labels.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action of the <fen>Visitor</fen> which results in their departure.</def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element labels words or phrases that describe how quickly the <fen>Visitor</fen> is moving.</def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transportation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Visitor</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Visitor</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium.
In this frame, <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> is often expressed obliquely in a prepositional phrase headed by 'in' or 'by'.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the departure takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the departing takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Visitor</fen> departs from the <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Host
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host</fen> allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> to use his/her resources, and to remain temporarily at the <fen>Host_location</fen>.</def-root>
